headline: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
description: This chicken pot pie with pie crust is filled with creamy vegetables and chunks of cooked chicken for a quick and easy comfort food classic.
name: Easy Chicken Pot Pie
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
2 (9 inch) deep-dish frozen pie crusts, thawed

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Combine chicken, mixed vegetables, condensed soup, and milk in a bowl.
Pour the mixture into the bottom pie crust.
Cover with second crust. Seal the edges and poke holes in top crust.
Bake in the preheated oven until crust is golden brown, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: My daughter made this for us. Bake 1 pie crust on a pizza pan lined w/foil @ 350 F for 10-12 min. Saute cut up chicken in a little olive oil, add frozen mixed soup vegatables. Simmer for 10 min and add 1/2 c half and half. Simmer til hot. Cut pie crust int 1 1/2" squares. Serve in large bowls; sprinkle pie crust on top. Yum!
It was so very easy and my husband and I loved it! Thank you!

Amazing! Quick and easy. I used the refrigerated pie crust. preheated bottom crust in oven at 350 for 10 min with edges covered with foil for crisp crust. I added my own seasonings to cooked chicken and mixture ( I only like peas in my pot pie--used drained can peas). I used egg white on top crust and covered edges while pie cooked. My son and I devoured it!

Quick and easy! The entire family lived it. I used the frozen pie crusts from Aldi and leftover rotisserie chicken breast from Costco. I also used frozen mixed veggies. I tossed them in frozen. I did add an egg white wash to the top before baking. I was able to prep it during the day and pop it in the oven after practice. Definitely comfort food.

First, if you want a crunchy bottom pre-bake the crust about 10 minutes with the edges covered. Then add filling and top crust, cover the edges with foil while baking and remove foil for the last 10 minutes.

I made this recipe - no changes - delicious. Thank you to the other reviewers who reviewed THIS recipe! There's lots of recipes out on allreceipes.com that are more complicated. I wanted easy and delicious and this hit the spot.
My kids are big fans!!

So this recipe was wonderful. I also tweaked to my taste. I used one and half pack's boneless chicken. I used cream of herb and chicken soup, and half a can of cream of chicken. I also used frozen vegetables and used salt , pepper, onion powder , garlic powder, and Italian seasoning. I did precooked my crust frozen for 10 minutes first. Then added all my ingredients. I saw alot of complaints but with any recipe you can tweek to your liking. My fiancé ate half of it by his self very yummy. Also used refrigerated pie crust on top and brushed with an egg wash.
It was not flavorful at all. I used this recipe as a shortcut to my normal recipe and my husband and son, who love pot pie, hated it. I thought it was ok, just bland.

I added fresh mushrooms, some potatoes, rosemary, frozen mixed veggies in lieu of canned, and cream of celery instead of cream of mushroom. When my pregnant pie comes out of the oven, I’ll let you know. Update: delicious!!
Loved it. Really easy. Just a little dry. I will make adjustments on that.
It was easy and good.
This was easy, inexpensive,and delicious! Will definitely make again!

Very easy recipe to follow. I used a pre-bought crust on the bottom and a homemade crust on the top because that's what I had. I also used cream of mushroom with garlic soup, which is very flavorful. The top didn't look done at all after 25 minutes, so I upped the temp to 400 for another 20 minutes. I didn't add any additional spices or salt, though it could have used a teaspoon or so of salt. Overall, the pie is really good and we like it!

I’ve made this several times and it’s a family favorite. But it needs several tweaks. First of all, 30 minutes at 350 isn’t nearly enough baking time. 45-50 is more like it. Be sure to cover the edges of the crust while baking. Also, it’s really much better with seasoning. I add salt, pepper, onion powder, sage and a little bit of Beyond Bullion for depth of flavor.
So quick and easy! Delicious every time!

Tasty and easy recipe! Very easy to make small modifications or add seasonings to suite different tastes. I followed the advice of other reviewers and baked the bottom crust about 10 minutes before adding in the filling. I also used frozen veggies instead of canned, microwaving them for half the time first. This was my first time making pot pie and it was great! This is a keeper!

This is by far the best chicken pot pie I have ever had or made. For the chicken I used canned chicken. My vegetables were frozen vegetables and I used one large can of cream of mushroom soup because that’s all I had, to that I did add some shakes of sage, rosemary, and I did bake it in a store-bought deep dish pie crust. How do you said yes make it again if it is for two nights!

This was delicious! I modified the recipe a bit. Instead of the canned veggies I used 1 cup frozen peas and carrots and 1 cop frozen corn and substituted 1 can cream of potato soup. Took an hour to cook but pie held together great when cut.

I doubled the recipe for leftovers and there was barely any left.

10 out of 10
I egg wash it and the two crusts. I also grill my chicken to my family's taste. I don't totally cool the chicken, the oven will finish it, and so juicy
Very easy with not a ton of ingredients.

I have made this a couple of times now, I cut down the milk (I wanted the cream of chicken taste to be stronger) and I use a bag of already cooked chicken fajita (from Walmart) and instead of two pie crusts I use a pie crust from Pillsbury (ready made, you just roll it out) and a regular pie crust for the bottom and added butter before adding the top crust. I love it!!!
Love it was go easy to make

Great easy pot pie! I followed this recipe exactly except I used frozen peas & carrots for the veggies, because that’s what I had on hand. Very yummy. Compliments from the husband, which makes this one a repeat!

Needs to cook longer than 30. Min
Added 10 more min 350
Easy

It’s an ok recipe for a quick and easy pot pie, however it needs some spices to give it a little flavor. As made it is kind of bland, however for a beginner cook such as myself, it was very quick easy and extremely filling.
Very easy chicken pot pie recipe using things one might already have on hand. I used cream of broccoli soup instead but kept everything else the same.
Easy and delicious.

Used this recipe for basics. Didn't want to use canned soup due to sodium. Used broth from bones from Costco rotisserie chicken. Not sure my sodium was less than 920. Thought gravy was too thin and added potatoe starch, then it got too gooey. Added liquid and it looked fine. Had way too much filling for standard pie crusts which were thawed. Ran to the store and bought deep dish crusts which were frozen. While the crusts were thawing, I noticed the filling looked rather thick. I thinned it out again and filled the pie crusts when I realized I forgot to preheat the oven. It was already close to 10 pm and the kids were hungry. I ordered pizza delivery. Kids were in bed and I thought about what went wrong. Then it came to me-- I didn't follow the recipe. Next time, I will.
It was a hit at my house! The recipe calls for a can of mixed veggies, so I diced half a can of potatoes and mixed with half a can of peas and carrots to make one can of veggies. It was delicious.

This is one of our favorite go to dishes, either using 1 pint of home canned raw pack chicken, or leftover turkey breast from a cooked turkey. We always keep pie crusts in our freezer for this easy meal. Hint: it is better leftover, as it cuts out more solidly when it is cold. We also use the mexican style stir fry veggies as the veggies, which is delish!
my family loves this recipe. I add 1/4 teaspoon sage to it.

This is my extract recipe I use but I Sauté 1/4 cup onions And 1/4 cup butter before I add all the rest of the ingredients gives it more flavor I also boil my chicken breast then shred it so it’s more moist and when I put pie crust on top before putting in oven I melt butter in a cup and brush the top of the pie crust before I put in oven so it’s flaky and crispy and buttery when I take it out and not dry ??
I added pepper and poultry seasoning.

I wish I could go beyond 5 stars!!!
I followed the recipe exactly; only addition was about 2 tsp ginger and 1 tsp paprika.
This is a VERY EASY, VERY TASTY recipe !!! 
I got alot of compliments for this dish but I told them I could not take credit; it was not my recipe.
Will definitely make it again!!!
Definitely going to add more sauce next time I make it but it was still delicious. The entire family enjoyed it
Love it it usually turns out great!
I added some oregano, thyme parsley, salt & pepper. I used leftover turkey from thanksgiving dinner which helped as well. I will definitely make it again and tweak it some more!
Excellent recipe! Easy to make.

It's DELICIOUS!!!.. but I will probably do as some other reviewers have.. and pte bake the pie shell...omit milk...My pie fell apart...once the pie cooled for awhile its was better but still I don't want to wait to eat dinner after I've just spent time making it!., Pie needs to be more solid for presentation and be ready to eat without becoming a mess.
I made scratch piecrust just for the bottom and added mashed potatoes across the top of pie. Baked about an hour for extra crispness....so good....

The most important thing in using recipes is to read the reviews They are most helpful and can save a lot of time and money. I used frozen veggies and deep dish pie crusts. Its important to saute onions and cook veggies and chicken separate. One trick I have learned is to under cook the pies crust and cover the edges with aluminum foil. Remove during last five minutes. I also found using Alfredo sauce for base with sherry or wine to taste. This adds a great favor.

Excellent and easy,This is the second time I have made this, I changed a few things this time around, I used what I had available, and turned it into a pork pot pie, First I cleaned diced a small pork roast I had in my freezer seasoned it with pepper and pink salt and cooked in a skilled until it was fully cooked, I removed it and drained the oil and put it in the veg mixture, in the same pan I saute'd half a diced yellow onion until soft and added it to the bowl of filling, then, instead of Condensed cream of chicken, I used condensed cream of mushroom and cream of celery, 
mixed well and poured it into the prepared pie shell and covered the top crust with an egg wash, ( I love the way an egg wash makes the pot pie crust look.) 
Your recipe is turning out to be a great "base" to start from when making different varieties of Pot Pie. Thanks for it!!
Excellent just as written. Grandkids who said they "hate" vegetables ate it right up! Thanks for the recipe.

So good and so easy! Slight modifications: bag of frozen veggies instead of canned. Added onions when I cooked the chicken as well as rosemary, thyme, and garlic powder. Used a can of cream of celery in place of milk. Threw in some hot sauce which added a nice flavor (no spice at all) I also highly recommend putting the bottom crust in the oven for about ten minutes before filling just so it doesn't get soft and soggy! (Poke some holes to keep it from bubbling up) We will definitely be making this again!
I made it exactly as the recipe posted and my family loved it.
easy, quick tasty. I'd add some more herbs/seasonsings and make it again!

This is a great dish. I did substitute some ingredients only because it was on hand. I used 2 cans of cream of potato soup with the 1/2 cup milk. I also added some hot sauce as others suggested. It turned out great. Will be using often as we love pot pies and this taste much better. Thanks for sharing!!!
This is my "homemade pot pie" recipe I've been making for years...except nothing is homemade. I use the refrigerator pie crusts and make the following changes:
I had to modify this recipe. I used 2 - 10 ounce cans of white chicken and 1 - 21 ounce can of Veg-all vegetables. It was kind of bland, but very filling. I will make it again!
First time I made this. Yummy. A few minor tweaks for next time but that is because of my oven and my ingredients I used. Very good starter recipe

I love lots of meat so I use 2 chicken breasts rather then the 2 cups. I also use a 5.5 inch pie plate rather then the 9 inch. the 5.5 is better for a single serving .I rub some flour around the pie plate before putting in the pie crust. I cook it for 60 min. then let stand for 5 min. before serving. it's like the store bought has a small circle of doughy crust in the middle. no bigger then a quarter.
It was very tasty. My family loved it!
This recipe worked out really well! I used Turkey instead of chicken (Christmas leftovers), and it was super tasty!
I love love love this recipe! It's so delicious and perfect.

I used 2 cans of soup, skipped the milk and added 2 baked potatoes cubed. I also bake the bottom crust before filling as others have said. 
The great thing about this recipe is you can put in any seasonings you like - pepper, bell peppers, seasoned salt, garlic powder - and it comes out tasting the way you want.
So easy and good. I used the low sodium soup but I like the taste of fresh celery, onion and carrot sauteed then added the frozen peas and corn to the soup. But Tressie needs a better photo. :)

just made this for super, with the creamy blueberry pie for desert, but we are so full we are saving it for tonight with TV. But the chicken pot pie is awesome, I added tiny cubed potatoes, I browned them with the meat and onion. Great recipes, with left overs.

1 can of cream of broccoli, 1 can cream of chicken, 2 cups cooked shredded chicken, half a can of milk, 1 can mixed veg, a couple dashes of soul seasoning, garlic salt, onion powder, poultry seasoning. Pre-cooked the bottom crust 10 min at 350.

I have used this recipe many times and it is always a hit. It's easy to make when you're in a rush and very tasty. There are only two things I change. First, I use frozen mixed vegetables instead of canned as I'm just not a big fan of canned veggies. Second, I have found that adding a bit of chicken broth really makes it flavorful, plus most recipes I've tried tend to be a little dry. For my personal taste, I add between 1/4 and 1/2 have cup of chicken broth while mixing the other ingredients

I did change a bit. I slow roasted the chicken, seasoned with poultry seasoning and garlic powder, with white wine in bottom of baking dish and covered with foil. I roasted extra and froze a couple of cups of shredded chicken to make this a second time. I also used frozen veggies, thawed and drained. Finally, I baked the bottom shell for 10 minutes or so before filling, and baked the whole pie around 45 minutes. Very tasty, and satisfying with a salad on the side. My husband also loved the leftovers!

Made it with canned veggies and cream of chicken and milk. Made the pie crust myself with (1 1/2 cup flour 2/3 cup of Crisco, 1 tsp salt and 4-5 tbsp cold ice water.... split dough in two parts (1 top 1 bottom) for 9 inch pie. I also added a little chicken in middle and chicken feet. The kids loved it! Will most likely put a few more spices in it next time and fresh vegetables as it was on the bland side. Overall it turned out I very well!
Great recipe, for a much more savory flavor, use the Heinz chicken gravy in the jar instead of cream of chicken.

Love it! I put the chicken and soup in the crock pot all day, with about an hour left I shred the chicken, then add the frozen veggies and milk. Cooking the bottom crust at 350 for 10 minutes is a great idea, even if using thawed frozen crusts- a hit every time and gets everyone to eat vegetables!!

I cooked the bottom crust for ten minutes at 350 than I used cream of chicken instead of milk added green beans corn celerly carrots onion and broccoli and cooked chicken in a sautee pan to warm it though before adding it to the pie cooked for 30 minutes my family loved it

I made this for dinner tonight, I used pillsbury refrigerated pie crusts so I had to cook it a little longer and warmer. I also used a bag of frozen steam fresh mixed vegetables instead of a can so I steamed them in the microwave beforehand. It's turned out delicious! Super easy and yummy!
I make this all the time.
I made a deep fish pie - so added 2 cans of cream of chicken soup and only 3/4 cup of milk. But found it to be too runny. Delicious but runny...maybe I should add 1/4 c of flour next time?

This is a great fast recipe. Although I took the extra 10 minutes to chop and cook fresh veggies And sauté them. I also added some thyme, fresh garlic and oregano to taste. DELICIOUS! Made it all and ready to serve in less than one hour! And the last 30 minutes was just baking in the oven. It's nice beaches enough could easily make two pies if you are having company and its plenty of food! YUUUUM!
Pretty good recipe. I'll try a turkey one on Black Friday when I have left over turkey.

Very simple to make and to add your on flare. I added potatoes and a little cheese. I also used a hot and ready whole chicken from a local store. Made this dinner super quick. Will be making this again.
4 instead of 5 because it didnt call for salt n pepper, i of course added it. Didnt change anything else very yummy

Very good flavor! My wife, who is very picky, liked it! Followed the tips and changed canned to bagged veggies, added diced whole potatoes, added some onion powder, garlic powder and Thyme, and a can of cream of celery. Then I mixed the veggies in frozen, not thawed, brushed the top with butter and cooked for 55 minutes at 350 degrees (just when it started bubbling on top). Top and bottom crusts cooked perfectly. Just a note; the added potatoes and canned soup make this one thick pie! Be prepared for leftovers!

5 stars after changes....I don't really care for pot pie, but had seconds of this. I followed the suggestions of others..used refridgerated ready made crust, baked the bottom crust 10 minutes before filling. I used 1 can cream of potato, one can cream of chicken and the milk. I boiled 2 split chicken breasts the day before and shredded/cubed it into the mix. I added pepper, salt and a couple shakes of garlic salt. It took longer than 30 minutes for the crust to brown. If you don't heap the filling you can get 2 small pies from 1 batch so you have more crust per serving, my husband likes the vegetables, so best to just heap it all in.

Pretty freaking good! All I did was add more chicken and I put cheese inside and on top. I cooked the first pie crust for ten minutes as recommended and added the egg on the top crust. Other than that it was really tasty and I loved how easy it was! :)
Added 3/4 cup of potatoes and turned out great!
Very simple to make. I added a little garlic powder to the chicken and used rolled pie crusts rather than frozen. So delicious!
Quick easy and very tasty
We loved this recipe! It was so simple to make and tasted awesome!

My husband ate 1/2 the pot pie himself! I made it exactly according to original instructions except for adding a few spices to the filling (per contributor Jaden: "Also I added 1/2 teaspoon each of pepper, thyme and tarragon, and 1/4 teaspoon of garlic powder to the entire mixture."). These spices made it very savory and yummy. I am fairly certain it would have been a bit bland without them. I let the pot pie sit for about 5-10 minutes after removing from the oven and the filling was just right, not dry or runny. An easy, tasty recipe I will certainly make again.

This recipe was easy and a favorite at our house. I used frozen veggies instead because I don't like canned veggies that much. I did have to cook it a lot longer than suggested so the top was flaky and brown. I will make this again!

Pretty good on a Sunday night in the middle of Winter.. Added extra veggies (garlic, onion, celery, carrot and fresh parsley) plus another can of Creme of celery soup and Creme of chicken soup and dropped the milk, used chicken broth instead

I made this recipe on a whim..... My husband has a classically trained tongue and he says the recipe is perfect the way it is. He could not stop talking about how good it was. I will be making this again!
I substituted the mixed vegetables for diced and boiled potatoes and carrots! Delish!!!! Good for those who have picky eaters or just want something a little more filling.
This was great and super easy with a rotisserie chicken and premade crusts. Will definitely make again!
Fresh vegetables and home made onion soup make this a winner. As it is, it's not really even food. You might as well buy a frozen pie and not bother having to clean the kitchen afterwards.
I made this for a family get together. And it was a huge hit. I had no left overs, and I took 4 pies!!!!!
Used a bag of frozen vegetables instead. Added a touch of Louisiana Hot Sauce to the mix as well.

Why would you rate a frozen/canned veggie, store bought crusts and canned soup recipe like you would rate a fresh, home made recipe? Come on people...you searched it for the simplicity!!!! Thanks for a great recipe that I will make time and time again when pressed for time!!!

Great recipe, super easy. I always use cream of potato soup & 2/3 cup of milk and the taste & consistency is terrific. Not too gloppy, not too watery. I agree with other reviewers about adding spices. 5 stars!
I love all the comments, added some of your changes to mine and brushed top of crust with egg wash to brown top......

This recipe is an awesome basic recipe you can tweak. Cheap and delicious. I used canned chicken- great way to get away from that "canned taste" and add moisture. I added 1/3 dried Parmesan and lots of black pepper for flavor. I also went without a top crust and covered the top with Swiss cheese instead and covered with foil. Baked for 30 at 350 then uncovered for an extra 10 minutes. Absolutely delicious and held up perfectly for left overs.

Here's an interesting thing to do with the top crust. Make the bottom of the recipe as directed, keeping the top crust frozen. Pop it out of the pan it comes in, crumble it up quickly (not too fine), and mix with some shredded cheese. Sprinkle the crust/cheese crumble on top and bake.
Its good, and really different.
My kids LOVE this easy recipe and it's a great one-dish meal.

Very good! I used two cans of cream of chicken soup one can had herbs in it, I added thyme and basil and only have a cup of milk. I baked the bottom crusted for ten minutes and brushed the top with an egg. Next time I will probably sautéed onion and garlic first then add to the mixture.

Me and my family love it. I've made it many times now. Other than using canned chicken to save time,and seasoning to our personal tastes, everything else is exact. It's very easy to throw together after a long day at work.
It's easy and quick. The trick is to get the other pie crust on top without tearing. I trim off the edges and drop it onto a piece of wax paper. Then it is easier to get it on the pie neatly.

I too am giving this recipe four stars, but only because I changed it slightly. I use *two* cans of Campbell's Cream of Chicken WITH HERBS soup. With that and some ground black pepper, I don't need to add any other spices. This recipe is really delicious; a quick and easy comfort food that my hubby loves. I'm sure improvising with vegetables is fine as well.
